thread.title: Is this the ultimate renovation project?
thread.title_full: Is this the ultimate renovation project?

title: Is this the ultimate renovation project?
text:
Take a sneak peek as our domestic A330 aircraft gets reconfigured with its lie-flat Business Suites, designed in collaboration with Marc Newson, and next generation model of the award-winning Recaro seat in Economy. #QFnewlook News Corp Australia 19 Aug 2015 News 
SO YOU think it’s hard renovating your house — what about revamping an aircraft built for 300 people? 
In a massive project, Qantas is overhauling 28 of its Airbus A330 planes, at a rate of one per month. All up, it that will take 200 engineers a staggering 226,000 man hours to complete. 
Each aircraft will be totally gutted, with interior features such as the carpet, seats, galleys and even the lavatories removed and replaced. The work begins. Source: Supplied 
In total, there will be 250,000 parts fitted to the A330 aircraft fleet. 
More than two kilometres of new wiring will be installed in each of the planes, with some getting more than 200 square metres of new carpet. And there will be 21,000 new seat cushions! Out with the old, in with the new ... Source: Supplied 
Qantas has 18 more A330 planes left to renovate. Everything must go. Source: Supplied 
Check out this dizzying video above to get a feel for the amount of work involved. We’d be “wheely” tired if we were them. It doesn’t even look like a plane anymore. Source: Supplied All done! Source: Supplied
